content.text: Web APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) are interfaces provided by web browsers that allow JavaScript to interact with the web page and its underlying web platform, including the Document Object Model (DOM), the network, and the browser itself.
Web APIs are not part of the JavaScript language itself, but are instead provided by the browser environment in which JavaScript runs.

content.question: What is the purpose of a Web API in JavaScript?
options: To provide a way for JavaScript to interact with the browser environment and the web platform
To provide a way for JavaScript to interact with databases
To provide a way for JavaScript to interact with hardware devices
To provide a way for JavaScript to interact with other programming languages
content.answer: To provide a way for JavaScript to interact with the browser environment and the web platform
